fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let S be a smooth separated scheme, and f \colon X \to S a smooth proper morphism.

html:ol.html:li: In rational cohomology, the Leray spectral sequence E_2^{pq} = \operatorname {H} ^p(S, \operatorname {R} ^qf_* \mathbb {Q} ) \Rightarrow \operatorname {H} ^{p+q}(X, \mathbb {Q} ) degenerates (E_2=E_ \infty).

If \bar {X} is a non-singular compactification of X, then the canonical morphism \operatorname {H} ^n( \bar {X}, \mathbb {Q} ) \to \operatorname {H} ^0(S, \operatorname {R} ^nf_* \mathbb {Q} ) is surjective.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let us fix f, and prove that (i)\implies(ii).

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Hodge Theory II › Applications and supplements › The fixed set theorem

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let S be a smooth separated scheme, and f \colon X \to S a smooth proper morphism.

html:ol.html:li: In rational cohomology, the Leray spectral sequence E_2^{pq} = \operatorname {H} ^p(S, \operatorname {R} ^qf_* \mathbb {Q} ) \Rightarrow \operatorname {H} ^{p+q}(X, \mathbb {Q} ) degenerates (E_2=E_ \infty).

If \bar {X} is a non-singular compactification of X, then the canonical morphism \operatorname {H} ^n( \bar {X}, \mathbb {Q} ) \to \operatorname {H} ^0(S, \operatorname {R} ^nf_* \mathbb {Q} ) is surjective.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let us fix f, and prove that (i)\implies(ii).

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Periods of integrals on algebraic manifolds, III
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: @article{5, author = {Griffiths, P.A.}, title = {Periods of integrals on algebraic manifolds, {III}}, journal = {Publ. Math. IH\'{E}S}, volume = {38}, year = {1970}, pages = {125--180}, }
